verbs.description: liquesce (third-person singular simple present liquesces, present participle liquescing, simple past and past participle liquesced)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To become a liquid; to liquefy.
examples: It is, of course, the nature of the London fog to descend and liquesce at its own whim. Merely two hours later, Waterloo-bridge presented an entirely different scene.

entries.meaning: (figurative) to become more like a liquid
examples: At many points notes liquesce like the liquid letters, so that the interval from one note to another is begun with a smooth glide and does not appear to have a stopping place en route.
